bio: I'm sorryvrerror, digital artist from Thailand. I joined Optimism in April 2022 and started launching NFTs on Optimism Stacks in June 2022.
contributionDescription:
I am a graphic designer, writer, and entrepreneur passionate about art. In June 2021, I embarked on my journey as an NFT artist, and it eventually became my full-time occupation, with my projects primarily on the Ethereum blockchain.

In June 2022, I launched my first project, 'Bored Town,' on Optimism, recognizing it as an ideal platform for NFTs due to its lower gas fees. I leveraged NFTs to promote businesses and events, using my art and marketing initiatives to attract new users to Optimism. As both an artist and the founder of a pioneering project on Optimism, my work garnered attention from companies and projects in the web2 realm, allowing me to introduce them to the world of web3 through Optimism Stacks.

contributionLinks.description: Bored in Blue, the collection to promote Optimism NFT on Coinbase wallet..
A link to promote Optimism quest on Coinbase wallet.
Bored Town on OpenSea, the collection to promote Optimism NFT on OpenSea
Bored Tarot, the collection to promote Bored Town space on Galxe.
Bored 101, the unique 1/1 NFT collection on Optimism
The Vintract, the collection to promote SRANN skincare product on Optimism.
Mangmoom, the collection to promote Mangmoom publishing on Optimism
Ape Warrior Redux, the collection to promote young artist on Optimism
OP Radio interview about my projects on Optimism

impactDescription:
I introduced five companies, namely SRANN, Mangmoom Publishing, Tripster, NFT360, and Starlet, to the world of web3 through Optimism Stacks. I also welcomed NFT projects and protocols from Ethereum, such as Flower Girls and Omnisea, to participate in events on Optimism.

Furthermore, I harnessed my art to promote Optimism NFT and onboard users to Optimism and Base by collaborating with prominent protocols like Coinbase, OpenSea, and Galxe.
pwCategorySuggestions: NFTs, Optimism, Web3 Community Platform, Digital Art
